content.description: Start on the right side of the Hairpin Arete, pinching the arete with your left hand, and using a shallow right hand mono.  Stand up and pull onto the slab above (fun crux).  Once established on the slab, it's easy climbing to the top.
content.location: Just around the corner to the right of Hairpin Face, on the right side of the Hairpin Arete.

content.description:
Climb the up the arete and then move right before the loose rock, sharing the top out with "Raw Tips".

To start, look for a sidepull for the left hand around the left side of the arete, and a ripply crimp for the right hand around the right side of the arete.

Apparently a sit-start variation is also possible, obviously increasing the difficulty.
content.location: The North arete of the Hairpin Boulder. Just left of the "Raw Tips" problem.

content.description: Head up the slab without using either arete.
content.location: One of the boulders located inside the hairpin turn. Cube shaped, and very close to the pull through.

content.description: Climb the arete, from the north side (to the right of the north face)
content.location: Rock snob boulder, cube shaped boulder inside the hairpin turn.

content.description: Climb the right side face, on crimps.
content.location: North face of the cube-shaped Rock Snob boulder, inside the hairpin turn.

climbs.name: Rock Snob Boulder group, V0- route

content.description: Climb the white arete. Second photo is a very easy face.
content.location: This boulder is one of several inside the hairpin turn. It has one long established problem (#18 in the Swan Falls bouldering guide, Hairpin boulders).

climbs.name: Rock Snob Boulder group, V easy face

content.description: This is an unnamed boulder with an easy face, and easy access off the top. My first shot at bouldering!
content.location: See photo, there are several options to play around with. I'm just under 5', so this is a doable kids rock, with spotter and pads.

content.description: Start at the face level crimps, get your foot to stick to some tiny dishes, and make a reach for a higher left hand edge.  If you can make the reach and stand up without your foot popping, you're basically done.  Finish on good holds to the top.
content.location: Located on the opposite side of the Hairpin Boulder from Hairpin face.  To get off, downclimb the juggy arete to the right of this climb.

content.description:
Climb the slab face to the left of Follicle. Small crimps and delicate feet lead to an exciting move(s) to the lip. Top out.

This climb is not in the Swan Falls Bouldering guidebook. I don't know its history, name, suggested grade, etc., so if anyone has any info, please share.

Not really sure about the grade, but felt about as hard as other V3 slabs I've done, but your experience could be much different.
content.protection: A pad or two should be enough
content.location: The slab face to the left of Follicle. When descending the road, the boulder is on the right, just before the hairpin turn

content.description: Climb straight up the overhanging face using large edges.  The climb features great movement and fancy footwork on impeccable rock.  If you're in the area, this one is a must do!
content.location: Follow the directions to the Hairpin Boulder.  This climb goes up the overhanging face facing the road.

content.description:
Heel hook and slap up the arete.  Fun!

The sit start is supposed to be V5.
Start with a left hand in the slot and right hand on the arete.
Sit start with both hands on the arete. Move up the arete using any of the holds and top out the boulder straight up or up and right.
content.protection: Three or more pads are ideal, but you could probably make fewer work, especially if you are comfortable at the grade.
content.location: On the right side of the road when descending the hill. The boulder is just before the hairpin turn
